title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Quick zoom interview, asked about a mistake you’ve made & how you dealt with that. Heard back in about 1 week about offer contingent on passing NCLEX. Was able to start 2 months after offer
Interview Questions: What is a mistake you’ve made

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of two rounds of group panel interviews. All questions were behavioral and relevant to the job description and requirements. Overall easy questions and friendly interviewers. Process was well coordinated.
Interview Questions: Example of a difficult project deadline

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to manager via linked in, had 1 interview and waited for spot to open up on her floor for almost 2 months before getting offer. Then waited for offer from HR.
Interview Questions: What kind of organizational skills I have

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. I got identified by a recruiter who sent my resume to the department staff. After that there was two interviews, one with management and one with the doctor that I would be working for. Interviews were very laid back, basically just telling me what the job was and if I wanted it I could have it.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: There were first two video interviews and then a presentation where you were expected to demonstrate your ability to form a research question and present results to an in-person panel.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then a week or two I received an email to come for an interview. Just google basic behavioral interview questions and you will be ok with the whole process. Don't stress!
Interview Questions: The basic behavioral interview questions: why do you want to work here? tell me a time when you settled conflict

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions:
I had scheduled an online interview for a position I found on another hiring website. During the interview, I had the opportunity to speak with the Nursing Director of the unit I would potentially be working on. The conversation felt casual, focusing on my job history rather than clinical aspects. I was informed that I should expect to hear from a coordinator, as two more individuals would be reaching out to ask additional questions.
To my surprise, I received a job offer and the coordinator promptly sent me the benefits information via email. At this point, I am in the process of evaluating the hourly rate they initially mentioned, as I am considering whether or not to accept the offer. It would be helpful if Glassdoor included a fourth option in the "Did you get an offer" section, such as "Yes, but I'm still considering it." Just a suggestion for updating that section.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about the unit/s you worked in 
Tell me why you want to work for Brigham & Women's Hospital?
Have you handled ____ & ____ equipment?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: They asked typical interview questions. Tell me about yourself, experience, strength/weakness and what do you do for self care. For the most part they were always nice and I only had a bad experience with 1 manager
Interview Questions: What do you do for self care?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, asked about you and your average behavioral questions. In addition, why you wanted to work here, and ask your background, etc. They are very welcoming to questions as well and encourages them.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strength and weakness?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview. A recruiter interviewed me but my ultimate supervisor did not. The recruiter took a liking to me and had placed me in a somewhat similar role at a different hospital.
Interview Questions: Do I have a science background, and if not why this field

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: They ask you typical interview questions about customer service skills and how you handle stress. Will ask directly from resume about certain positions and how you handled those stressful situations
Interview Questions: Did you ever have to deal with difficult situations or people and if so how did you handle that?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Had two zoom interviews - the first one 30 minutes with HR and the second 1 hour with a PI. Both times the only question I was asked was: "What questions do you have for us"?
Interview Questions: What questions do you have for us?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very very friendly staff and they construct multiple interviews before hiring, ensuring that each and every individual that they have work there is the right fit and brings positive vibes to the work space.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you went above and beyond for someone else.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process really depends on who you’re working for. Neurology department was great but the references part of the interview takes a long time. Usually included one formal and another informal interview
Interview Questions: How do you think working here with align with both our goals?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Long. Two interviews then a couple of weeks extra for the reference check and the CORI/background check. Otherwise the process is very straight forward, just long. Takes a month. Bb
Interview Questions: What is your experience? Why do you want this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: All interviews (three total) were entirely virtual via Zoom. No in-person visit was required. Very efficient communication and got back to me quickly. Onboarding process was somewhat extensive but that is to be expected when working in healthcare.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working in a fast-paced and sometimes stressful environment?

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position, was contacted a few weeks later by the PI's assistant for an in-person interview. Was a small lab so spoke with just the PI and 2 post docs. Received a request for references at the end of the interview and was given an offer within a few weeks. No room for negotiating salary due to grant constraints.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself

Why are you interested in this position?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process took around 2 months from start to finish. I had three rounds of interviews, and spoke with six people total. At the end, I decided to accept the offer.
Interview Questions: Aside from the betterment of the greater good, why do you want to work in Healthcare Development?

title: Research Trainee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Direct interview with PI of the lab about background and interest and offered place on the spot. Visited the lab on the day of to get to know others in the lab and projects in the lab.
Interview Questions: Past research experience and interest

title: Clinical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of researchers in a variety of positions (ex. PI, project manager, senior research assistant). It was a very welcoming and informative conversation where I was asked plenty of questions and was also able to ask them questions! My interview was conducted over zoom.
Interview Questions: How did you find this position? Tell us about ___ experience (on my CV).

title: IS PROGRAMMER/ANALYST I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: First Phone screening, then have an interview with the hiring manager, and finally the panel interview with all lab members, all steps are behavioral questions and the scheduling is through emails.
Interview Questions: What's your 5 year career goal?

title: Chief of Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview was a 20 minute phone call from a generalist, she said the next round would be within two to three weeks if one were to make the initial cut
Interview Questions: They wanted a recap of exactly what was on the resume, it seemed a waste of time.

title: Histology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a really easy process. You schedule an appointment to interview you go there on the date, make sure to be early as it can get really crowded and busy.
Interview Questions: What process do you go through for tissues

title: RA II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two sets of interviews for this role. One with the team, with about 6 people, and one with the Primary Investigator for the Division. We discussed the different projects they had going on and what I had previously worked on.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best for this position?

title: Clinical Trial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a phone interview after application was submitted. Received a quick phone call then invited for in person interview. One on one. Simple 1 hour chat
Interview Questions: What are your future ambitions?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interviews. Coordinate your availability with HR/administration based on your availability and the staff's availability. Laidback interview but informative on position and expectations. Plenty of time to ask questions and learn more about the position
Interview Questions: Why I thought Brigham and Women's would be a good fit

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple. I enter red the company through a recruiter who connected me with the manager of the department I work in. We did a video interview with the manager and then one with the provider that I would support.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with patient facing interaction?

title: Business Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very pleasant! Everyone that I spoke with was very kind and passionate. The whole process took a bit long but worth the wait.  I will say though that for an entry level position, there were a lot of rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult decision you had to make within the past year?

title: IS Programmer/Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds video interview. The first is related some tech questions with technique manager, including the coding skill, statistical knowledge and so on. The second is talking with director of the department about the main research direction of the department
Interview Questions: How do you usually generate figures in r?

title: Medical Asisstant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Brookline, MA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with the practice managers, fairly simple. They ask about your interest in the medical field and why you want to be a medical assistant, your background, etc. I would say this was the easiest interview process I had ever gone through
Interview Questions: Asked about my interest in the medical field

title: Medical Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Telephone call with HR to talk about the position
Zoom interview with management, head physician and then team. Final interview with upper management. Then offer from HR. Process took about 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working in a stressful environment?

title: Coop Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a technical part and a series of general questions to see if both you and the company can benefit from this. Was pretty good and I did end up taking the role.
Interview Questions: Background, degree, past internships and future plans

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had two rounds of interviews asking for about my level of expertise and what I brought to the role. Overall the interviewers were very pleasant to talk to and because I came in prepared it showed how much I not only want the role but care about the work
Interview Questions: What work have you done in the past that has prepared you for a role like this?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I met with both management and a team member. I had three meetings before I received and offer. Two meetings were with a more junior team member, and my final meeting was with the office manager.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my college experience.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied directly to the laboratory. I interviewed with just the PI of the lab, and got a tour around the office and laboratory. Met a few other people in passing.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for DA position in a department to support their studies. Met with PI, head biostatistician, and RA. Mainly talked about my experience and the statistical work I've done in the past, 5 year plan, and what I wanted out of a job.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: Grant Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Prompt response to my application. The people I spoke with  were very polite and eager to discuss the opportunities at BWH as well as why they loved working there. All were incredibly knowledgeable and easy to speak with
Interview Questions: Tell me about the experiences you've had that could be applicable to this position.

title: Injury Prevention Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I met with the person who would be my supervisor and then another person in the department, back to back, in Zoom. The first person asked me standard interview questions while the second spent nearly the whole time telling me about their department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What do you look for in a supervisor? What motivates you?

title: Genetic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple rounds of interviews with team members (colleagues and supervisors)  as well as an individual activity to assess your knowledge and skillset surrounding a real-life genetic counseling scenario.
Interview Questions: What were some of the main conclusions from your capstone project?

title: Market Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and comfortable! I first met with my potential project manager and later met with my potential principal investigator. We discussed my qualifications and they'd gauged my interested for the study I'd be working on with them/
Interview Questions:
-background/qualifications
-interest in their research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
-one phone screening
-one meeting with project manager
-one meeting with project manager and PI
Overall very simple and straightforward. These interviews differ depending on the team you'd be joining. But working here now, most all the research teams are very friendly!
Interview Questions:
-description of background experience
-how my prior experience relates to this role

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really simple. After submitting my application in the online portal I was contacted directly by the PI in the lab I applied for. We spoke for about an hour and then after receiving my references they submitted to HR for an offer.
Interview Questions: To explain more about my research background.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: 4 rounds. One with HR, then hiring manager, then research administration team, then the PI. They asked questions to test for culture fit and also test experience with patients in a clinical setting. Overall it was a good interview experience.
Interview Questions:
Strengths, weakness, teamwork style. 
SAS related questions.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted via Zoom call. I met with the unit manager and a unit educator. They asked me about my relevant experience and described the work environment of the potential job.
Interview Questions: What were my past experience and skills?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the whole team and then they ask for references and then they ask for references who fill out an easy questionnaire. You then  will get called with a job offer. Not room for negotiation
Interview Questions: why do you want this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy process- there was a phone screen and then 3 zoom interviews to meet the team and see if it was a good fit. The interview questions were fairly easy
Interview Questions: Tell us about your last role

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Simple and forward. Need to be able to convey that you can work in a fast paced environment and are able to adapt and learn.
Have confidence and be personable and professional.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?

Tell me about a time that you had a disagreement or difficult time with a coworker or patient.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly straightforward, although there was some confusion between HR and the hiring team as to who was responsible for what along the way. It was an overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: This department had the longest interview process I have seen in my career. Seven interviews (2 group interviews with the team) and a 30-minute presentation. Everyone was nice and engaged, and the interviews weren't difficult, but PHEW it's a long haul.
Interview Questions: 30-minutepresentation on my leadership skills.

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, conversational interview. Had a phone screen with the HR department then project coordinator. They asked the typical interview questions, situational questions. Salary range was 50-55k so I ended up turning it down.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to prioritize work.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short and general questions were asked like why this position and previous experiences. One annoying thing is that the interviewer never followed up even when I emailed him asking about next steps.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous experience working with patients?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly average, it didn't drag out but it wasn't super swift. The first was an initial phone screen where the recruiter told me about the role and the team/department that was hiring. The first official interview round was a group panel with 4 people from the team. It was an easy-going interview and everyone was impressed and was relating to my stories and experiences. The second interview round came a couple of weeks earlier and the task was to present a 20-minute presentation on any topic, including a past project done in school, in front of the whole department, and a 10 minute Q & A. The third interview round was also a couple of weeks later and that was a one on one meeting with the executive director of the department where they tell you about the department, what they do, and the working style, and then they asked me questions about how I adapt to different environments and what kind of working style do I prefer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a group member and how did you resolve it?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went smoothly. Although covid-19 made the process a lot longer than expected I found that everybody was doing the best that they could. They not only asked questions about myself personally but also about how I could help the hospital.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the unit?

title: Clinical Research Trainee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview! The first interview was through phone call with a research assistant, following with the senior staff member. The senior staff member had called me via skype (however this was prior to COVID-19). Overall, nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Q: What has been the most meaningful experience to prepare you for this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They email you to set up a phone interview. Then you go back and forth until you both set up an agreed upon time. If they want to move forward, you will be asked questions at the phone interview before being scheduled for a virtual interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions regarding my interest/passion for patient care and goals for the future. Reflected on previous patient care experiences both positive and negative. How to deal with difficult patients and how to address patient barriers to care and health.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult patient encounter you had and what did you learn from it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was over zoom. She was nice and liked me but they wanted someone more permanent so ultimately I didn’t get the job. Asked why I wanted the job. Very different from most interviews just because it was over zoom which I wasn’t used to. Seemed like a decent job.
Interview Questions: Talked about medication safety and the patient

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I saw the job online and applied on their website. After a few weeks, they contacted me and scheduled a 20 mins phone call interview first and then an onsite interview.
Interview Questions: They will ask about the level of programming experience and the classes/knowledge of biostatistics.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Easy, informative, conversation type interview with two Principal investigators. Got a good understanding of the type of research and what would be expected of me. Had the opportunity to ask questions and the interview was more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research in this department

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call and was 'pre-screened' with some average interview questions and skills questions over the phone. Then I was scheduled for an interview, where I was asked harder question including rating my skills and very specific examples.
Interview Questions: What is a time that you brought an idea that improved efficiency to your boss or supervisor?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with recruiter was great. They asked normal/typical questions and was able to give a good picture of the role. It seemed like with COVID the company was very busy and needed help.
Interview Questions:
What made you apply for this role?
Tell me about your experience?

title: Inventory Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Merged phone call with the area manager and shift supervisor. The conversation surrounded the field I would be dealing with day-to-day and asked if I would manage. All in all, it was a basic bare-bones interview.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with us before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: An email was sent out on what to do followed by a zoom meeting link. A specific time was discussed where both parties were available. Once it was the time and day, there were a couple of people already on the zoom link. They all asked questions about me.
Interview Questions: What classes did you like in college?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy  and informative. I recommend applying. Answered all my questions and was overall, just an enjoyable experience as a student who does not have much experience with interviews.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation you had at work and how you handled it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, very few questions. The interview process was actually conducted through a program at my university that placed me at the hospital. The relationship between my university and the hospital made it easy for them to know what to expect in an intern.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in an internship?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted about a Zoom Session interview with the practice manager on Monday and had an interview on the same Thursday of that week. Submitted references on Friday and quickly received an offer the next Tuesday.
Interview Questions: Name an instance when you’ve dealt with an unhappy patient?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screening interview with the current research coordinators that was very casual then there was an interview with the principal investigators that was longer than the phone screen and more in depth.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a work situation you hadn't seen before?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview and phone screen, friendly and get to you know and your goals. They did not ask any behavioral questions. They were friendly and also described the role
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Describe past research

title: Patient Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then meet in person. HR person was very nice, very friendly. Acted as if she really wanted to hire me but did not follow up. was a little confused.
Interview Questions: What are some administrative experiences you've had?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview, 1 zoom. Recieved offer 2 weeks later. Requested 2 to 3 references, but they only reached out to one. During the zoom interview, had to complete a basic science assessment (analyzing math, basic math, etc).
Interview Questions: Q: What is a time you showed initiative?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: You have to make very good preparations, and then you will get for what you can contribute to the research group. It will help a lot if you have publications, especially those very relevant to the position you are going to apply for.
Interview Questions: you set skills are the most important

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was mailed that I am selected for an interview at Brigham and Women's Hospital and was asked to give my availability which I did, but my point of contact never scheduled the interview. Even after mailing her to schedule an interview, she didn't end up doing that.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview. It was about one hour and consisted of mostly behavioral questions. Some included strengths, weaknesses, future career aspirations, and describing a time where I handled a conflict.
Interview Questions: What are your top strengths? Provide an example of how you've demonstrated those strengths

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with everyone on the team for 30 minute interview sessions, ending with the lab PI. Standard questions, very kind and interested in hearing about the experiences their interviewees have had.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Extremely long interview process spanning almost 4 months from the time I applied.  Everyone I met with seemed engaged and cordial but it was time consuming.  Leading up to the on site interview there was one screening interview with the recruiter followed by 5 individual interviews and 1 panel interview.  The on site portion of the interview lasted 4 hours and included meeting with the team I would be leading.
Interview Questions: How do you manage work life balance?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a phone call with hiring manager and then actual department (2 people) I applied to. Note that the company was not willing to pay more $16/hour and did not negotiate.
Interview Questions: The usual interview questions... nothing out of the ordinary or extremely difficult to answer.

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Loved it, everyone was nice and I was communicated to well. I had a hard time connecting with HR after my initial offer but my now boss was very very very on tip of keeping me in the loop and letting me know my position was secure
Interview Questions: about my lab experience

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted for a phone screening to learn more about the position. Then I was invited in for an in-person interview with the current coordinator and the PI. Was given an unofficial offer the next day contingent upon successful background and reference checks. They then checked references and did a background check and received an official offer from HR a week later.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted was interested in the job? My past experiences/what I did? What are my future goals? Strengths/Weakness The interview was more conversational and casual talking about details of the study.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got invited to an on-site interview. Had a lab tour and I asked many questions during the tour for 30 min and then the sit-down interview for another 30min where the hiring nurse basically just went through two pages of standard questions with my answer recorded by another interviewer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work to meet a deadline

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with recruiter, video screen with hiring manager, and then onsite interviews. The process is slow and drawn out with little to no follow-up communication between steps. You don't hear anything for weeks and then they expect you to clear your schedule within a couple days. Just felt like a lack of basic respect. You get the prestige of working at Brigham so expect a lower salary range. I ended up telling them I was not interested in the role.
Interview Questions: Questions about general experience and challenges. No behavioral interview questions.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Firstly a phone interview was conducted and then I met the lab supervisor in person and was introduced to the lab. HR then got in touch with the offer and salary.
Interview Questions: Why choose research over industry?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Position had been vacant a long time. Was told interview and hiring process would extend over many months which was curious. Seemed like leadership was still specking out desired job responsibilities during the hiring process
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was overall an positive one. First there was a phone call screening then a lab visit and then there was to be another round which would be the final one
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I first met with the clinic operations supervisor and I would like to say that it was a very easy interview! She was so nice and we had a really good conversation going for over 45 minutes. She asked a lot about my experience working in the health-related field as a student and as a volunteer through my various activities. Although I didn't have a medical assistant certification, she told me that if hired, I would undergo a training process in lieu of the MA certification which made me worry less. Overall, I thought it was a great interview and she even wanted me to meet her supervisor. I think the interview the her supervisor was a little more tense, and I wasn't having as flowy of a conversation with her as I did with the operations supervisor. It might be that I had a lack of questions, only because I asked a lot of questions with the previous supervisor so I couldn't come up with any at that time. Although now, it's been 3 weeks and I haven't heard back and am thinking I didn't get an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time in which you proved yourself to be an adaptable person?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the hospital float pool and she was excellent. Very accommodating, the culture at Brigham was very focused on teamwork which is nice. She also asked some questions about how I work in a team and how flexible I am being in the float pool you need to be adaptable and take initiative.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have do you think would benefit you in this position?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Scheduling of the interview was a little cumbersome as I was conversing with both the HR recruiter and hiring manager separately. There should be one point-person that the candidate communicates with. The actual interview with the hiring manager was smooth and there were no unexpected questions.
Interview Questions: How would you solve an interpersonal dispute while at work?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The overall process was great. I got an itinerary and the entire process was explained to me (how many people I'd meet with and when they were looking to have the position filled by).
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult employee in the past?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Unbelievably thorough interview process—it began with several rounds of phone interviews over the course of a couple of weeks and culminated with a full day of onsite interviews that also included a presentation/lecture to one of the senior technology teams. The process was incredibly thorough and communication was great throughout. Unfortunately, they offered the job to another candidate, but the hiring manager provide some very helpful feedback and encouraged me to keep in touch. I would have rather had the job, but the process was worthwhile and helpful in understanding my own strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: How would you set up xyz program?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the hiring manager because I had previously interviewed with them. I drove 3 hours each way for the interview. I Thought the meeting went great but i never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: friendly, welcoming, informative. I was called by the Nurse Director and planned out the date and time over email. It was about 40 minutes long with a good mix of talking about myself as well as the floor.
Interview Questions:
What is something you need to improve upon? 
Why this hospital?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: First round was a phone call interview. Half an hour. Self introduction and past experience. No difficult questions. But it seemed like they would prefer someone with experience within a specific disease area.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self. Your experience and skills.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed to set up a phone interview with PI. After about 20 minutes with the PI was transferred to speak with 2 current RAs. Pretty straight forward process with standard questions and lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Give example of a challenge that you've overcome

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The process was quite typical. The interview process was first a phone interview with the operating manager. Once I passed that, I had an in-person interview. The in-person interview was a 1:1 group interview. Each person asked me one question and I answered them. Then there were 2 people who would be my future colleagues who both asked me questions and told me about the job. The hiring process then went to the HR office of the hospital in general. They guided me through Brigham's orientation and the many immunizations and tests I would have to do. 

It was a very off-the-cuff interview and really allowed me to be myself during the interview. People were really nice but I wish they were more frank about what the expectations would be later in the game.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, followed by in-person interview. Standard questions asked, your average interview. Once I was offered the position, three week wait to set up health appointment and complete drug test.
Interview Questions: How do you handle confidential information?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initially had a quick 15 minute phone screening, then went on to interview with a panel of two people at the office the following week. I never heard back from either person I met with, or the hiring manager, to let me know that I was no longer being considered for the role (I'm assuming because this was 5 months ago).  I had sent follow up emails and received no response.
Interview Questions: Pretty straightforward questions about my roles and responsibilities at my current job, why I was looking to leave my current job, asked me to describe some projects I've worked on.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: extremely friendly and engaging, want to know interests and abilities, great facilities. Very easy to get to locations with public transportation or driving. Most people who have interviews get the job, HR weeds out "bad" candidates and managers mostly hire peole they interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: New Patient Coordinator and Administrative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Over the past few months, I have had several in-person interviews with various different departments.  After an initial phone screening for each, I met with the hiring staff for each position. It has been four times now that I have been "ghosted" after the first and even second in-person interview. As someone who is looking to relocate to the Boston area, I found it incredibly rude after commuting for many hours to an interview. Now, I am at the point where I am incredibly shocked by the unprofessionalism of the hiring process.  By "ghosting" me and not offering any feedback, I have often waited, hoping to hear back while ruining my chances with other employers (after being told they'd get back to me in a week about an immediate hire position for example).  The process, in all, has very negatively affected my job search and I hope this helps anyone in the same situation.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a situation with a difficult supervisor?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward, I came in with many years of experience so the interviewer sensed my confidence. I dressed business professional and had my l resume in hand. I didn’t think too much about what I would say, but had an idea of the meaning behind my job description and stuck close to that during the interview. I didn’t seem rehearsed and I tried to connect emotionally with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: What do you do at your current job, what would you bring to this job?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I met with 3 people and they were each about 30 minutes each. Mostly chatting about my experience and what I wanted to get out of the job. It was a good interview I think
Interview Questions: Why Brigham?

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two interview process. First was with administrative leader and consisted of basic questions and insight into my background. Second interview was more personal and detailed. Took about a week to get the second interview and now I'm waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: How would you handle differing personalities?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied via LinkedIn. I was contacted by e-mail directly by the hiring manager within a week of applying and was invited for an in-person interview. The interview was with the hiring manager and the person currently in the role I was applying for. After the in-person I was asked to complete a writing assignment. After submitting the writing assignment I was invited back for a second in-person interview to meet with a few of PIs and the dept administrator. After the second in-person interview I received an e-mail from HR for reference submission. Received a verbal offer from HR within 2 days of references being successfully checked. HR was fairly removed from the entire interviewing process, but, was involved in the offer and negotiation process. I was able to successfully negotiate both salary and start date.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in your past role(s) when you took on an increasing level of responsibility that was outside of your job description.

title: Regulatory Document Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very organized. I was interviewed by the chief of cardiovascular research. Routine behavioral questions and questions about resume. After the face to face interview, they told that they will tell their decision within a week but got rejection mail after 10 days.
Interview Questions: What made you think that you are a great fit for the position

title: Tissue Typing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact was a phone conversation to gather information, then a full interview with 9 people from the lab, then contacted by HR for references.

HR never contacted me about a final decision after the interview, neither did anyone from the lab. The hiring manager is AWFUL at emailing. She never once sent me an email, I called her every time. She also assured me that the lab could work around a "time commitment issue" when I told her I could only work for one year because it is my glide year before med school. Turns out, it was the only reason I wasn't hired. They toyed with me for a full month and a half and I turned down other offers because the interview went very well and the hiring manager spoke highly of me as well. I never got a rejection email, I had to call and ask if I got the position or not.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with monotonous work?

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Went through a staffing agency, which is how most Practice Assistants get hired. Multiple call-backs to interview with several members of the team. All behavioral questions with a few questions about previous experience. Asked discriminatory and inappropriate questions that were tough to evade.
Interview Questions: How will you balance being a mother of 2 children with your job, especially during the winter when there are a lot of snow days?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted about 2 weeks after sending in the initial application online; had the interview and everything was going well, only to hear back from them a month after the interview --after I had gone home for the summer. Still offered to fly back and work for the summer, but never heard from them again even though the phone call was asking about hours I could work.
Interview Questions: How would this position fit in your career track?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions:
1.  Submitted an app online - very easy to navigate. 
2.  Was called by a department manager over the phone - we basically had a phone interview of basic skills/background experience. 
3.  Then was called by recruiter to say that the manager liked me and wanted to move forward. 
4.  I came in and met with the manager in person, toured the unit, etc. 
5.  Recruiter called me and started the process for reference checks.  
6.  I completed occupation health appts, submitted background checks, etc. 
7.  We set an orientation date and I started.
Interview Questions: Just about my background and experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by the PI of the lab. We had few conversations on email to schedule an interview. I went for the interview, which was briefly talking about each other. Not much of technical questions, just brief overview of lab and how we are going to start working
Interview Questions: What would you do to trouble shoot Western blot if you have background ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call and was asked general screening questions which lasted about 30 min. The interviewer was nice and explained the position well, and took time to answer all of my questions
Interview Questions: Time when you had to overcome a challenge

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a short phone interview, followed by an in-person interview. I met one on one with the manager and then took a tour of the unit. I met a few of the staff in the department and was introduced to the director. The manager was forthcoming about the next steps in the process and indicated that he wanted to hire me at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe the workload or workflow in your current position.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: As for research position, i think the interview process vary across different team. I was offered to have an interview with PI.  The interview was smooth. The PI also introduce me about the lab environment. I also met with other two members of the research team.
Interview Questions: They ask me about my future plan and the detail of previous project.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview and then went in to the office. The interview was a little uncomfortable and they asked some unexpected questions. I spoke with the PI and the project manager that I would report to, 30 mins with each person.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time that you executed a project. How did you manage the other people? What steps did you take to get the job done? 
After they described the research projects to me: which project interests you most and why?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Brookline, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. They were really helpful in terms of helping me apply for a better position than what I had originally applied for.  I accepted the position but found that it was not a good fit for me. I applied for a Practice Assistant II position and they offered a Managed Care Coordinator position instead. The Managed Care position was a bit difficult than what it needed to be. The department didn't offer enough training to really tackle the position.
Interview Questions: What are your skills? What are your goals in the company? Where do you see yourself with this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a few internships through Brigham, then was called and selected to interview for one. I was then contacted for a phone interview with the potential manager, once I made it through that round I was supposed to have a skype interview with the manager and her manager. However, they couldn't get the skype to work so we just had another phone interview and was told I'd be contacted in a week if I got the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Brigham and Women's?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy to schedule an interview. They were very prompt. Interview lasted 1 hour, met with 3-4 people. They gave me a few scenarios and wanted me to prioritize them
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: After the initial phone screening, I met with the practice manager and physician seperatly. Both gave a warm and welcoming feeling. The usual HR questions were asked and felt more like a friendly conversation than an interview.
Interview Questions: what are your career goals

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: HR got in touch with me and facilitated the meeting with the nurse manager. They asked me a couple basic questions but I got the impression that this had no impact on my interview with the manager. The in person interview with the nurse manager lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a stressful work situation and how you handled it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied to almost 20 job positions and heard back about an interview a few months later. I had one interview with the nurse manager and nurse educator, then heard back 4 weeks later with the job offer.
Interview Questions: If you just got report and have 5 high risk patients (she described each patient), who would you see first and why?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Newton, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very conversational and easy. If you are a people person interviewing should be easy. As long as you are qualified, and understand the complexity of the role, and can achieve it, then it should be a good process for you. Believe in yourself is half the battle. Do your very best, and Good things will come to you in time.
Interview Questions: How do I manage a busy day?

title: Transplant Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Director of Transplant Surgery and three other transplant coordinators. The majority of the questions were based on my personality, conflict resolution, and patience.  The interview lasted approximately forty-five minutes. I was notified y the staffing agency I receive an offer to start a week from the date I interviewed.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Media Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great process, lack of follow-up. Completed a phone interview and did a 1:1 interview and a group interview with three separate groups of people.  Felt the interview went extremely well and then never heard back from the team about the plans for the position. While I felt it was a great fit, the team lacked professional follow-up.
Interview Questions: Experience in the industry.

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application on Brigham & Women's career site and was contacted by the PI the following afternoon. A phone screen was conducted that lasted about 25 minutes. The PI asked me why I was interested in joining the research team and specifically about skills and achievements I listed on my resume. I was honest about my experiences and admitted when I lacked or had little experience in a specific technique or training. However, I showed promise through discussing my strengths and character traits. We set up an appointment for an in-person interview to take place the next day. I was asked to look at the lab's webpage and familiarize myself with research projects and published papers. The interview lasted about 3 hours, and it was very relaxed. I was showed some of the tasks I would be responsible for, and then we talked about which of the projects interested me and why. Questions came naturally, and I came prepared with a few written down, both about research topics and general employment. The PI did not ask me to go through any protocol listed on my resume or have me test my analytical or statistical skills. I talked extensively to the two other RA on staff, one that started a month ago and one that has been in the lab for a few years. They asked me standard questions such as what I majored in at school, what techniques I know, and my organizational habits. I finished up the interview back with the PI where I was asked for references, provided with a figure for salary, and told that I got the job and that it just needs to be finalized by HR.
Interview Questions: How do you handle negative feedback?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy going. I met with both practice managers and they asked me about why I want this job and my prior qualifications. They asked me questions about my resume.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, got an e-mail to set up a face to face interview, and met with the supervisor for the role(s) that I applied.  This was the second and last time I applied to Brigham, I thought the first time around was just me slipping through the cracks... however, when you sit down for an interview, do a decent job in the interview, send a thank you email, and weeks later send a follow up to see if the position is filled or not and get no response... I find to be incredibly disrespectful and lazy. For this to not happen once but twice means that it may be some sort of protocol to ignore people after you brought them in for an interview and told them you'd be getting in touch with them either way. It's one thing to not respond in the first place but to set up a lengthy interview and just never respond is baffling. 

It was a blessing in disguise because I ended up finding a great job that respected my skills and my time.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest part about your current job?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and submitted a questionnaire. I was then contacted via email to interview. I sent in availability and went for an interview. I was contacted for a second interview. One week later I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process required two in person interviews that each lasted approximately and hour with the individuals I would have been most closely working with. I was asked a lot of questions directly related to the population I would be working with, why I felt that I was capable of handling the job, and my concerns about the position. I was also asked how I best would handle situations with case studies.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflicts at work in the past?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about previous experience, my duties and shown around the lab. My PI to be described the field of interested of the lab as well as staff structure. It's was a nice conversation about lab work
Interview Questions: What kind of duties did you have?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Informative interview, took approximately one hour and spoke with two people. - they were both very helpful. Realised that the job did not match my interests or skills midway through the interview.
Interview Questions: Asked about research experience

title: Research Assistant I/Day/40 Hrs Pharmacoepidemiology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: First had phone screen, which was very typical. Then an in-person interview. First half of the interview was with the entire group (5-7) of research assistants. I found this to be very intimidating and not very welcoming. Then the second half of the interview was with the program manager. I found the manager to be a bit judgmental and terse. I was told there were only 5 other applicants at that level, but never received an email getting an offer or not, which felt a bit disrespectful.
Interview Questions: What is your research background? What do you hope to see in the future for yourself and for public health?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the department. I met with three different managers, one at a time, but back to back. Each manager discussed my qualifications, as well as describing the position from their point of view. I felt this style really gave me an idea of what I was working toward. I later came back to meet the chief to further discuss the position.
Interview Questions: What is one weakness you see in yourself and how do you manage it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The HR emailed me to set up an interview and was set up the following week. I was interviewed by two people. The interview was standard and was really short, lasted less than 20 minutes. The interview ended with a tour of center. They told me they would let me know if I'm hired so it was only one interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was easier than expected. The questions were easy and the process very short and accommodating. The entire interview took less than a week and the feedback was quick and helpful.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in working with the lab.

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied way back in Nov/Dec 2016, was contacted mid January and did a brief phone interview/screening. It was mainly asking my schedule and the manager giving me an overview of the job. This is for per-diem so I appreciated the clarity in scheduling.
Interview Questions: We see a lot of trauma here, how do you deal with workplace stress like that?

title: Medical Imaging Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online on Brigham and Women's website. I was then given questionnaire to fill out by HR about relevant skills and evidence of skills in experiences. Interviewed with human resources  in the Boston HR satellite office. Position was for 12 weeks, 40 hours a week, $15/hour
Interview Questions: They asked an example of when I took charge of a situation and exhibited leadership to cause a beneficial change

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sent in a resume and was contacted two days later for a phone call. Phone call went great and then asked to do a Skype interview the following day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Are you willing to relocate?

title: Interpreter/Translator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: they call you, give you an appointment and then ask you questions during the interview, when you are they will give you the position they will let you know by sending you an email
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, weakness, strenght ect

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR for about 15 minutes. About a week later, met with the VP of Marketing and the Sr. Digital Marketing Manager to go over my previous work experience and to get an overview of the job. Got a call back about a week later saying I was accepted. Very easy.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple interviews for 3 different positions. I have worked for partners previously, have a B.A., and an impressive work background. The process of interviewing with 3 different sections of the hospital took about a month. One position I'm glad I didn't hear back from, the doctor I would've been working for seemed like a pompous soulless human being, the second one I haven't heard from/don't care about, and the third I went as far as having my references fill out the online survey, however the coordinator has not responded to my emails regarding the next steps despite telling me to email her if I had any questions. My references took the time out of their lives to fill out the survey, but the coordinator can't take time out of her day to tell me if I'm still a candidate or not?  It's nice to know how this hospital operates. Keep up the good work Brigham.
Interview Questions: Questions weren't that hard. It's admin assisting, not rocket science. But apparently you need a Phd to sit at a desk all day.

title: Technical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
3 different interviews, Director of the lab, lab manager, and potential co-workers.
It normally took around 2 hours. 10 minutes waiting among each session.
They asked you if you had any lab experience or depth of knowledge on research or clinical lab experience. they asked you how to deal with stress and dispute with co-workers.
Interview Questions: Do you have any question for us?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Three separate interviews that consisted of two management personnel and meeting the team of assistants. First met with a doctor and got a basic run down of day to day work life. Then, met with management for personality test which consisted of three situational questions in the workplace. Lastly, met with four other assistants in a casual setting to get to know each other and talk about day to day work life.
Interview Questions: Three situation questions on how you handle certain instances dealing with co-workers and management. Have examples.

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Came in interviewed with practice coordinator and other admins. It was pretty laid back, not too many questions. They showed me the department and described the position in detail. I shadowed the other admin's for a little bit.
Interview Questions: Name a time that was difficult on the job

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Had an interview with the hiring manager and then with three leaders of the team.  Then I heard nothing for 3 months.  I called HR several times asking for an update and then 1.5 months later, saw on the "My Jobpage" on the BWH career site that my application was no longer active.

The communications throughout this process was not at all professional or considerate, especially given that it is a reputable hospital.  BWH should re-consider its PR pitches that working there is all about its employees.  Having gone through two other less than professional application processes at this hospital, I wonder not only how the people in HR can keep their jobs and if this is the reason why the administrative staff is less than competent.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email, and an interview was set up. There was one phone interview and one in-person interview. The phone interview was fairly brief, around 10-15 minutes and was a simple screening call. I answered some basic question. A 1:1 interview was conducted a week later and took about 40 minutes. It was a pretty standard interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us a bit about yourself:

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The first time we talked it was just over the phone. Over the phone initial, then in person for the second. Then I talked to the person in charge under PI and the research lead. We discussed the studies I would be doing also.  The in person interview occurred at the actual location
Interview Questions: Asked about my experiences

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
