Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview and after I had an interview in person for about 30 minutes. The questions were the usual ones that every company asks. I was interviewed by more than 1 employee. They shared their experiences at BWH, what they do for their jobs, what the admin assistant will do, and I was able to ask each of them some questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Administrative Assistant II for Connors Center for Women’s Health and Gender Biology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First of all, I showed up for the interview at least fifteen minutes ahead of time, having not been told anywhere specific to go. There is no reception are for visitors of the Connors Center, and when I gave the name of the woman I was expected to meet with, nobody could tell me anything. I spent something like half an hour being given the runaround and directed by security as I kept trying to get in contact with my interviewer. Then I had to wait something like another fifteen minutes for the interviewer to actually show up at the place I was told (by security) to meet her. Totally unprepared and unprofessional. I get hospitals are busy, but dear god.

The interview with her was pleasant enough, but the second one with the head of the center was nothing but judge-y. She picked apart every little thing I said and it honestly made me feel so terribly small. 

Oh, and I still haven't gotten any follow up response from them since this interview took place in AUGUST.
Interview Questions: How good are you at research support?

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I came in and met with the direct supervisor to the department.  She asked me basic questions as to what I was looking for, and told me what the job responsibilities were.  I then was given a tour of the hospital.
Interview Questions: The interviewer didn't really ask me any specific questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: easy friendly, took weeks to get an offer and to go back for a second interview,other than that it went fine, got email then set up the interview and then came back for another on another day. They could not schedule both on the same day
Interview Questions: my goals

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Got contacted by email and subsequently a phone interview, talked to someone on this position and heard back two days later by email, although this person said would get back to me the next day. Overall experience was neutral
Interview Questions: Basic background questions to get to know you

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and straight-forward. The people were nice and answered all my questions. I was very pleased with the process although I had to come back for a second interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: referral...almost no interview. One on one discussion with the hiring manager and the interview with the senior lab manager and then having lunch with the whole team....the whole interview lasted about 3 hours
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I arrived to my interview half hour prior to our meeting time. Met with the supervisor who explained the job duties. We talked about my experiences that he thought were interesting on my resume, then he took me around to meet other employees in the clinics.
Interview Questions: How well do I work with others?

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Confusing. Large employee funneling. Too much dependence on technology to process everyone. Must be a Partners Healthcare Management thing. They seem to use old outdated software systems. PeopleSoft is such an ancient HR management system that hasn't been updated since the 90s.
Interview Questions: My interview questions were more geared toward my research studies and my CV. Therefore, the questions asked are irrelevant and only specific to my career.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: An initial email connection, applied online, in person interview. The manager was very nice and professional. Showed me the unit and really wanted to sell the institution to me. I really enjoy the interview process and did not find it intimidating.
Interview Questions: what made you choose nursing

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Direct Call from Manager and was interviewed by two people. They called me for personal interview and later they cancelled position. 

Process was fast. I got call for personal interview in a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your Strength?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 rounds worth of 1-on-1  interviews. I interviewed with my supervisor, a physician, and the Executive Director of the department. Process took about 1.5 months. All questions were behavioral. I was approached by a recruiter about this position.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Short interview. Most of the time, was the hiring manager who was talking. She wanted someone to start working immediately even though in my resume said I graduated in May and the interview was in February.
Interview Questions: The classic question: Tell me a little bit more about yourself

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview

Interview Descriptions: They said it's typically one interview, I went for two. You meet with the manager that's going to hire you. I don't really have anything else to add as every dept hires slightly different.

title: Practice Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Dietetic Interview

Interview Questions: What has been the most challenging aspect of your career so far?

title: Material Handler Interview

title: IS Programmer/Analyst II Interview

Interview Questions: Tell me more about your project ******************.

title: Research Technician Interview

Interview Questions: Favorite research experience and why? What do you know about our lab?

title: Research Technician II Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very long and tedious with little promises. I had to keep following up and leaving messages but no one got back to me on the same day. I feel as if it took so long because I asked for a high salary and they wanted to see if they could find a candidate who wasn't asking for as much.

title: Neurophysiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone Interview with HR, Telephone interview with Supervisor, In person interview. Most of it seemed like just a formality. They have a set process that HR has to go by. The HR department does move very slowly.

title: Research Associate Infectious Diseases Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied online at the partners website, was then asked by PI to send my cover letter, then a phone interview, then an in person interview all within a week. Met with the PI, the office staff, and the current RAs

title: Clinical Reviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2014

title: Project Manager Interview

It was more of a meet and greet. Third was with HR to review benefits. The job description posted was nothing like the actual position. No career path out of the department.

title: RN Interview

Interview process was good. Met with staff and got a tour of the unit.  Pretty standard interview process.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths/weaknesses?
How would your colleagues describe you?
What do you think you need in order to be successful in this role?

title: Research Technician Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice, the woman I interviewed with was very welcoming and warm. They asked the usual interview questions like 'Why do you want this position and what makes you a good fit.." etc.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: it took forever to get information. i waited and waited to hear something back. and then i finally did. i was relieved when i got a phone call saying that they wanted me to work for them. YAY

title: Administration Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I Applied online. Meet the managers. The interview process was the same as most companies. Hard a dual interview process but everything was straight forward. Got the call back. Interview with administrators. Process took about a month from initial date of applying
Interview Questions: none. simple

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Technical Research Assistant I Interview

title: Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively simple. I came in twice for two one-on-one interviews. The Human Resources department then ran a background check and followed-up with my references. A start date was determined shortly after.

title: Technical Research Assistant I Interview

I was able to land the position some time later.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted through email. Went in for an interview. Asked basic questions

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Wanted someone with a bachelor's degree.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview

Interview Descriptions: I contacted the principal investigator directly for asking any vacancy for postdoctoral position. After two on-site interviews with PI and other faculty members, I got finally hired. My case was unusual, I did not have my research presentation in the lab meeting setting, instead I met all the faculty members by one-to-one meeting.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The process took two weeks, One phone interview and two one on one interviews.
Interview Questions: What do you like most about your current position.

title: Project Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Once you start the interviewing process, you are assigned a recruiter that  will be your guide. The recruiter will answer any  questions or concerns you may have. Your recruiter has a wealth of information about BWH and the process.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this job?

title: Practice Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Practice Manager and the Medical Director. The process was painless. Both of the people who interviewed me were great and I felt confident that I had gotten the job after the whole experience was completed.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your previous role?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to schedule the interview, but it was a very informative experience. I spoke to about 7 people, some of whom were very friendly others who were a bit more terse. They also seemed a little miffed about the idea of me applying for grad school in a few years. In the end they decided they wanted someone with more technical experience.
Interview Questions:
The answer (not the question) threw me on this one.  "Why do you hope to do working here"
I gave an answer about how I enjoyed the research they were doing, and how I wanted to contribute. I also said it would be nice to start to make a dent in my college loans. His answer "Well, that's not a good plan. Boston's an expensive place to live and we don't pay much."

title: Lab Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward but somewhat lengthy-- a brief meeting with the lab director and a tour was followed by several meetings with different groups of lab techs (1-4 people at a time) who each asked similar questions. Understandable enough because the lab is quite busy, but I believe the interview took about two hours. Great work environment, though; everyone was very friendly throughout the process. Despite trying to get in touch with the director, I didn't hear back about the position until about six weeks later (though I'm sure if I'd been hired it would have been sooner).
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty standard, but I was also asked about past lab experience, familiarity with specific tests, etc.

title: Managed Care Representative Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Research Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: thorough, great process that helped me get good idea of job. it was good to meet the whole team. enjoyed the process. i don't have any negative experiences from the process, and would recommend brigham.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. One the standard phone screening and then an in person interview. The in person was intense. I had to speak with 3 sets of people.  They were all nice and welcoming. I was even given a tour around the facility.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I first had a phone interview with the Research Tech who'd I would be taking over for. I was asked about what previous research experience... research techniques I was proficient at... my long term plan...what I liked most about research. 

In person interview with the PI I was asked the information above as well as what my weakness was.

All in all, typical research technician interview questions.
Interview Questions: What excited me about research?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: got to the lab, met a few people, gave a talk, had lunch with the PI and met a few people again. it was for the whole day and the Pi had sponsored the trip. The paperwork took a long time.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself after this training?
Why this lab specifically?
Are you willing to go outside your comfort zone (selecting a research project)?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit application online, and then in-person interview.
Interview Questions: No really any. The interviewer asked a lot about why I decided to do research in his field rather than my original area. They are very related, and I personally did not even see that as a departure from my original area.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Researchers brought me into their lab and interviews for about 1.5 hours. I was shown around their laboratory and introduced to all their co-workers. Met with the lead professor, lab manager, and other people.
Words added in order to meet the 50 word limit:
word word word word word word word word word word word word word word word
Interview Questions: Asked me about my previous work experience.

title: Clinical Laboratory Technoologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the web portal and was later contacted for an interview. It took a while for hooks to be cleared to actually offer me a position. It was a relaxed but sharp interview.
Interview Questions: What set me apart from other candidates?

title: Lab Control Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied on March 30th, 2013 and got a call from the lab supervisor in april 2nd week to schedule and interview. I went in an interview the supervisor ask one of her co-worker to give me a tour of laboratory for five mins. the co-worker gave me a tour and introduced me to Senior tech, MPA and other Lab Techs and told me how everything works. She brought me back to supervisor and our interview started. it wasn't a interview interview. I felt it was more like a conversation. She kept saying that i really impressed her with the answers. At the end of the interview when she asked me when i am able to start and pay range. I told her that i am available immediately and about the pay i answered her saying honestly, i have no idea what hospitals pay for the entry level positions so i am open to what you guys offer. And she goes like the answer you gave me really hit me off the right spot. I am impressed. In the closing she told me that it was a really good interview and within a week or less either HR or i will call you. So, after a week i called her back and she goes like i forwarded everything to HR and they will contact you. Does anyone have an idea how the procedure works. I mean i thing i did good in the interview. Can anyone share what they think. Please it would be really helpful because i am so nervous if i will get the offer or not.
Interview Questions: NO i didnt had any curveball question

title: Community Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
1. Apply online: upload resume, cover letter, and fill out individual job experiences (long and tedious process)
2. Interview with Supervisor
3. Review of references using online assessment
4. Interview with Supervisor and other administrators
Interview Questions: 10 expected interview questions, 1 curveball; rated on a 1-10 scale in regards to how questions are answered; interested in ability to influence positive change and level of commitment to roles and responsibility within job title

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing with the actual laboratory staff was easy and relaxing. The HR department asks the typical interview questions. The lab managers generally give a tour of the department and ask easy questions.
Interview Questions: The HR department asked what I would do in the situation of a patient that was a tough stick, or nervous about a blood draw and how I would handle it.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very formal and organized interview process. I gave a presentation first and then got a chance to talk with everyone in the lab for about 20 mins. Finally, someone in the lab showed me the lab general situations. I think the main part of the interview is talking with the PI and demonstrate your research.
Interview Questions: What's your plan for future? How long can you stay? How can you deal with difficulties in the life and research? What kind of research skills do you have? How about your family?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Usual - scientific presentation of past work to lab. Chat with boss and potential colleagues.
Interview Questions: Question about my hobbies was rather unexpected, usually it's just about science, future projects,, what I can do...

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for a different position online and was contacted by phone by the project manager. She mentioned the position I had no interest in as well as the RA position. We had a brief phone screen and then planned a 1:1 interview a week later. After that, I came in for a second in-person interview. Each interview went over the project extensively, and I was able to meet with the other research assistants to get a feel for the job. They seemed overworked and like they needed another RA.

The office environment was relaxed, with the dress code ranging from jeans to business casual. Apparently the wait list for a parking spot is years long, but the office itself is literally steps away from the green line. It seems like a very work-oriented office, not obnoxiously relaxed but not super high-stress, either. They were hiring to ease up the workload and had a very keen sense of what needed to get done and when.
Interview Questions: Pretty easy interview, nothing stood out as difficult.

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Got a email to schedule a phone interview after that got a offer for a in person interview. Worked as a temp before getting fire was offered the position and have been working there almost three years.  Staff is very close and helpful
Interview Questions: how well do you work with irate patients?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I was asked to provide a reference letter and then I was asked for an interview. The interview lasted about 2 hours, and included 30-40 minutes first with the Principal Investigator (hiring manager). Then, I was interviewed by the person I would be replacing. Lastly, I met the rest of the team and had a tour of the lab/offices.
Interview Questions: Do you feel you are able to do this job and why?

title: Neuropsychology Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was as pleasant as it could be. Given sufficient time to prepare, process was efficient and quick in response. The interview ran fairly on-time. However, the interviewers did not have a copy of the most recent documents they asked from me. The interview lasted a total of one hour with several individuals.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness? How do you address this weakness? What is an example of a difficult conflict you were involved in and how did you resolve it? Why do you believe you are a good fit for this position?

title: Administrative Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: There are six rounds of interviews in three hours with past fellows and three vice presidents. Talking with the vice presidents was a pleasure and exciting experience. The culture there is to pursue excellence. People there are highly educated. Their recruiting process is very professional, e.g. they mailed the detailed interview schedule and some of their brochures for us to understand the organization.
Interview Questions: How is the Deland fellowship distinguish itself from other fellowships in other hospitals?

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with one of the managers and then the director of the department.  The process was relatively straight forward as they screen their interviewees very carefully.  I flew in for the interview and there was no compensation for travel expenses.  Each interview took ~30 minutes and was an average interview as far as I had experienced in the past.
Interview Questions: What theories do you find most useful to your social work practice?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Standard phone screen, interview, final interview.  Final step meeting with PI.  No real test of knowledge.   Was pretty easy really, a lot of time explaining the job and working conditions.  A few name your best quality, worst quality questions.  Panel seemed disinterested and wanting to get back to work.
Interview Questions: What do you fear most with this job.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application via the online Brigham and Women's Hospital and Partners Health system. You can look at all your previously submitted applications but there is no where to follow up on your application. That is the real downside to this system. I suppose they get a large number of applicant and could not deal with the call volume, but it definitely makes the waiting game much more stressful. I was then called to schedule a first interview with some of the research staff. After that I was called back to meet with the study PI. I then continued with HR to give references and heard back from them with the offer about 3 weeks after my initial interview.
Interview Questions: I didn't get any curve balls in this interview

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: fairly straightforward, may need to wait a while to get all the paperwork processed. Interviews were straight forward, mostly generic questions. I had two separate interviews, one phone and other in person.
Interview Questions: What do you see as your role in BWH?

title: Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: One phone screening, one in-person interview.
Interview Questions: All pretty standard interview questions.

title: Call Center Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: THis was very Quick  and  comfortable,  not  a  long  process.  Just waited  a while until  I  started  working .
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application with HR. Within about a week, I heard from a nurse recruiter who asked me some basic questions over the phone about my past experience and what i was looking for in a future position. She told me she'd forward my application to both the manager for the job I applied for and for a few similar positions that we discussed. She called back the next day to schedule am interview for two of those positions. The job I actually took included an interview with my future direct manager and the nursing director. A week later they called to schedule a phone interview with the practice's medical director. After the phone interview, I was called by HR to "follow up" at their building, which turned out to be the job offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about a past project or team experience that did NOT go well. How could you have changed things?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was e-mailed 2 days after applying for the position to set up the interview.  Set a date to visit a couple weeks later, but it was moved back a week due to the PI being out of town.  Interview was fairly simple: first met with the hiring director, followed by the person currently holding the position, and lastly met with the P.I. All interviewers were friendly, and didn't really ask too many tough questions beyond why I wanted the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was comprehensive, supervisors and colleagues are involved and usually require a presentation. And the interview process was a normal one, it usually takes a whole day. I believe it is a good place for research, as this institute has so many world famous publications, but when I work here I got to know this institue do not support research well, scientists are much poorly paid comparing with the neighboring institute.
Interview Questions: How do you like your current reseach

title: Billing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was thorough, but not to overwhelming. The process includes multiple interviewes with several people. The Interviewers were polite and provided really good insighth on the job I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: There were no tricky questions. All asked was related to the experience related to the job.

title: Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Received call for interview in November then another call in December for 2nd interview. Received offer letter in January and started working in February. The whole process is very slow.
Interview Questions: They wanted to make sure I was comfortable with dealing with patients. They gave me 2 scenarios and ask how I would handle them.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the hiring professor and subsequent meetings with (what are now) work colleagues and other department staff. It was a long day from giving a presentation to having 1 hour or 30 minute meetings with several staff members ending in a meeting with the hiring professor who intentionally had the meeting last so that I would be tired (advice being keep energy for the last person of the day).
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at that particular department

title: Volunteer - Medical Career Exploration Program (MCEP) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process is very simple. You fill out the application and attend the orientation. Bear in mind that orientations are only offered about 6-7 times in a year and you need to get recommendations from a professor or a professional colleague as well. At the orientation, you hand in the application materials and learn more about the program. It is a great opportunity to learn more about medicine. After the orientation, you wait a week for your name to be placed in the system and then you pickup your ID badge and can begin to volunteer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Transplant Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions:
I first met with the head surgeon and administrator .
The next day, I met for 4 hours with various members of the team. Very organized.

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2010

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was very easy. Had one interview with the PI and was hired.
Interview Questions: Nothing really difficult.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was notified by HR to answer a few questions. Went in for an interview with the PI, then met with lab manager and several research fellows. After about a week was contacted by HR again with an offer.
Interview Questions: Not many questions were asked of me, it was more of a conversation of things that were going on in the lab and what their research goals were. I believe talking about that with them gave them an understanding of my science knowledge.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I contacted with the principal investigator of the current lab with the connection of my phd advisor. I was invited to fly to boston for one day visit of the lab and give a seminar. I also met with several lab members during my visit and talked with the PI about future projects. The entire process went smoothly and I was offered a postdoc position a few days after my visit.
Interview Questions: What's next for your research?

title: Technical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: The job posting was found on craigslist (in 2010) and my CV/cover letter were promptly responded to.  I traveled to Boston for an onsite interview and was told I was "over qualified" for the position.  I was unexpectedly asked to interview for a different position under a different supervisor. Overall, the interview process was quick and painless. Despite interviewing for a level two position, I was then offered the job as a level one due to lack of experience. I used this position as a spring board, gaining much needed skills and real world experience. Great for entry level work, but don't plan on staying long.
Interview Questions: Some of the tasks you'll be required to perform are routine and monotonous. How will you deal with such routine tasks?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
the process of hiring is very simple for postdoc position.
visit of the lab, meeting coworker, face to face lunch and discussion with the PI
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Group interviews with cross-functional team leaders. Relaxed environment over two days of interviews. Felt welcomed and valued.
Interview Questions: What is the worst mistake you made in a previous job. How and why did that happen. What were the repercussions.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Quick and asked for specific examples.  Whole thing took about 3 weeks.  Interviewed with 2 people for about 1 hour and then recieved a call about a week later and accepted.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Consisted in a Phone interview and 1:1. Technical questions.
Interview Questions: Long term career plans

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: going through national match once a year after residency
Interview Questions: standardized process with friendly athmosphere

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted a couple of months later for an interview. The interview process involved two separate site-visits. During the first visit, I met over 2 days with faculty of my current department, the head of the department, and gave a research presentation of the science I had already done. They took me to dinner and the next day I had another full day of meetings and a "chalk-talk", where I presented work that I might like to do if I came there. Approximately a month or so later, they invited me back to spend another two days talking to people, but not giving any presentations. The offer came a month or so later.
Interview Questions: Why do you think this is the right place for you to start your independent research career?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Referral from a friend
Interview Questions: How do you feel about pharmacy?

title: Technical Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Going over resume, highlighting administrative experience as well as experience where there was a lot of multi-tasking involved. 

Then a 'get to know you' conversation. 

After that you have to fill an online reference form and they will contact your references.
Interview Questions: I originally interviewed for a Research Technician job, mostly wet lab. And because I also had experience with coordinating projects, I was asked if I'd like to also be considered for a Tech. Research Assistant, which I had no idea what that role would entail.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: A few rounds of email communication, one in-person interview with PI, one visit to the lab and meet current members of the group.
Interview Questions: None. If the fellow's research interests and skill sets meet the expectations of the PI, should be a simple process.

title: Lab Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I met with Co- Director and was interviewed for 15 minutes before being offered the position. I was not fully prepared for the expectations of the position but when you are in a competitive environment you have to expect that. It took a few months to connect with enough people to develop the network I needed to properly complete the projects I was assigned to complete. It was a challenging experience both as a Lab Supervisor and as a manager.
Interview Questions: I found that communication was not straight forward. Often individuals were not clear about their timelines.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: basic questions that any interviewer would ask in order to get an idea of your work ethic and professional and academic history as well as your capacity to do the job. ie: how do you handle stress? what are your current aspirations? walk me through your professional history? etc. i also met with a number of the senior clinicians.
Interview Questions: how do you handle stress

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brigham and Women's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: My resume was forwarded to my potential boss from a BWH recruiter and he contacted me directly via email for an interview. The interview lasted approximately 40 minutes and consisted of a review of my past relevant work experience, future goals, and an explanation of how working at the position would benefit myself and how I could be a benefit to the workplace.  I was also asked about my hobbies. Afterwards, I was taken on a tour of the lab, and then a tour around the research area to various important buildings. A few hours later, I received an email offering me the job and encouraging me to take the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 20 years?
